title: Herbal Ear Oil (Karna Purana Supportive)
excerpt: A gentle sesame-oil–based ear oil infused with soothing herbs for external ear massage and comfort (not for instillation when eardrum issues are suspected).
content:
## What Is This Ear Oil?
A traditional, sesame oil–based herbal oil infused with soothing botanicals (such as manjishta or other calming herbs) intended for external ear massage and supportive ear-care rituals.

## Ayurvedic Significance
Karna Purana is the classical practice of applying warm oil around the ears and in some contexts, instilling very small, practitioner-approved drops. This formula is intended primarily for external use to soothe and maintain ear comfort.

### Key Benefits
- Soothes outer ear and surrounding tissues.
- Helps maintain balanced ear hygiene when used appropriately.
- Supports gentle massage rituals for relaxation.

## Ingredients
- Cold-pressed sesame oil base
- Manjishta or other soothing herbs (infusion)

## Usage Instructions
- Warm bottle in a water bath to a comfortable temperature. Apply externally around the ear and gently massage the area. Do NOT instill into the ear if you suspect a perforated eardrum, active infection, or severe ear pain—seek professional evaluation.

## Packaging
- Small dropper bottle with clear cautionary labeling.

## Safety & Consultation
- Do not insert into the ear canal if you have ear discharge, severe pain, sudden hearing loss, or suspect eardrum issues. Consult an ENT or practitioner before any instillation.

## Why Choose This Oil?
A carefully prepared, traditional supportive oil for safe external ear-care rituals when used with proper guidance.
